column5: As a lesbian, I 100% agree with this meme.

Oh definitely!! Being out in a public space with people in general makes me nervous, but especially when people yell. Hate loud noises in public. People laughing also makes me nervous for some reason as well because I'm convinced they're laughing at me.
Those clothes are so cute!!
Bots filled up the queue already.
Insane amount of comments already. Probably mostly bots tbh.
I absolutely adore that jacket!! It looks so comfy.
I think it looks great!! I'm also a big fan of colour coordinating my shoes with something I'm wearing.
I Am Sober
Thank you!! It's been really difficult, but I'm so glad of how long I haven't self harmed for.
*presses button a million times*
This is the cutest and most wholesome post I've ever seen. I have a cat as well, and she helps so much with my anxiety.
Yeah it is strange! Posted this at around midnight, and I do tend to be more depressed at night, so it makes sense I guess.

Literally told my doctor today that I wouldn't care if I got the coronavirus because if I was dead it wouldn't matter anyway. It would be unlikely to kill me, but if it did, at least then I don't have to make the effort of planning my suicide and doing it.
Thigh gang! Can't cut my wrists because my student nurse uniform has short sleeves.

Feeling the exact same way lately. Struggling with suicidal thoughts and I just don't see the point in anything.

I've been seeing a therapist recently. I've definitely found it quite helpful because it gives me an opportunity to open up and be completely honest with someone. Recommend you to see a therapist if you haven't already.  However, it's difficult to have the motivation to see one if you're feeling so depressed. I used to think to myself "why should I bother? I'm going to kill myself soon anyway". Feeling that way was awful. 

Right now, just focus on getting small things done. You and I both know that depression makes it difficult to even do the simplest things - getting out of bed, eating, showering, and other everyday activities.
Yup, even right now. Been clean for almost a year, but I've planned to relapse tomorrow when I know nobody's home to stop me just because I can't deal with the constant urges anymore.
The struggle is real. I know a lot of gay or bisexual men, but no bi or lesbian women.

Thank you!! I completely agree with what you said about nurses having an impact on a person's life. Even as a student I've been involved in really difficult and emotional situations such as helping to provide end of life care.
Thank you!! Glad to hear you're feeling better! <3

As someone that is studying to be a nurse and suffers from panic attacks and anxiety, it's incredibly disheartening to hear about your experience.

Really sorry that happened to you - you deserve to be given the best care you possibly can. Nothing can justify the lack of compassion that nurse had towards you. 

Your feelings are valid and deserve to be taken seriously by healthcare professionals.

How are you feeling now?
Good luck, you've got this!! â¤
I absolutely adore the colour combination!! This makes me want to try out eyeshadow more.
Thank you!! I hope you're having a great day too!!
Looking good! Nothing's better than a leather jacket!!
The pattern is lovely, isn't it!? It's what made me want to buy it in the first place. I absolutely love clothes with polka dot print.
Thank you!! â¤
That's the best compliment I've ever received omg thank you.
Added you!!
I wasn't sure about the belt to be fair, but I thought I'd just put it on because it's been a while since I wore it last.
Thank you so much!!

Congratulations!! That is such a huge achievement!! You're going to be great as a MH nurse because you'll be able to use your own personal experience to empathise with service users more. 

 I just started studying mental health nursing at university last September. It's difficult, but definitely rewarding when you go on clinical placements. Hope you enjoy the course and I wish you the best of luck!!

I'm quite feminine for the most part, and so I don't fulfill most of the stereotypes, but I LOVE cats, I mostly hang out with guys, and I always have short nails. Used to wear a lot of flannel but I don't anymore just because it doesn't go with my overall style.

So sorry you had to experience that!! I've been through the same thing. A friend I grew up with and considered one of my best friends suddenly stopped talking to me when I came out. When one of my friends asked her why, she literally just said she thinks I'm disgusting for being a lesbian.  It sucks that some people are like that, but if that is how they treat people who are different, they're not worth your time anyway.
In the exact same situation right now with an assignment I have due soon.

So sorry you had to experience that, that's awful. It's unfair that you've been criticised for having a rhinoplasty (which looks great), especially because your ex broke your nose. At the end of the day, it's your body so you should be able to do what you'd like without judgement.
Those doc martens make the outfit even better. You look so good!!

I think the problem with mesh shoes is that fluids will possibly be able to go through the mesh, which is obviously something you don't want if you're dealing with bodily fluids. If you get leather shoes, they're much easier to clean because you can just wipe the dirt off.
Congratulations on getting accepted!! I'm glad you're doing better now.
Thank you for letting me know!! I'll check them out.

https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/aw/d/B07VYSGHN1?psc=1&ref=ppx_pop_mob_b_asin_image

It is really protective!! Unsure whether or not it would hold a BP cuff though.
Bloody hell, an actual unpopular opinion. You've got my upvote.
Started clinicals already last month. Went to a nursing home, so at that time they didn't really expect me to have a stethoscope.
I completely forgot about engraving it!! I'll make sure I add something to it to prevent theft.
Way too often.

Going for a long walk

A warm bath with some bath bombs

Face masks

Reading

Talking to my friends about things unrelated to anxiety to take my mind off things

Listening to music
Look that good fresh out of bed!? I'm so jealous.
You've achieved so much and should be super proud!! Also, I love your style!!
I get a mix of excitement and panic when I see I've got a reply.
I used to not mind Christmas music that much, but after working in retail I absolutely hate it. Same repetitive songs for hours in shops.
Congratulations!! That's such a massive achievement and I'm proud of you.

I completely understand what you're saying. I'm in the same situation myself. I feel guilty for being depressed because I know a lot of people are less fortunate than I am and would be happy if they were me. 

Unfortunately, I don't know why we're like this. I just hope this comment maybe makes you feel a bit better by knowing you're not the only one experiencing this. <3
Love an all black outfit - you look fabulous!! ðŸ³ï¸â€ðŸŒˆ

Bought them from the ASOS website last week. They were suppose to be Â£55, but were on sale for Â£20.

https://www.asos.com/yas-petite/yas-petite-check-paperbag-waist-trousers/prd/11944714?clr=&colourWayId=16346193&SearchQuery=yas%20check%20trousers
I've just got one too that I absolutely love!! It's black with a rainbow-finish chestpiece. Can't wait to use it!!
Thank you so much!!
https://www.clarks.co.uk/c/Griffin-Lane/p/26143113

Yeah they are leather. I went to Clarks because I heard from my friends that they sell comfy shoes. Can confirm that they are the most comfy shoes I've ever owned - even after a 12 hour shift my feet don't hurt at all.
Thank you!! I bought the shoes a while ago and I've found that I can wear them with basically everything. Just instantly makes any outfit look much better.

I'm sorry that you're going through a difficult time! Really hope you feel better soon. Like all the other commenters have said, you look amazing!! I absolutely adore your hair - it looks so healthy and voluminous. Been wanting hair like that for the longest time.

Amazing job!! You must be extremely intelligent and dedicated to do so incredibly well! I know how difficult nursing programs can be, and so you should be really proud of yourself!

I just started my nursing program a few months ago. I'm hoping I'll do just as well as you have!
